story-context.acceptanceCriteria: 1. **Given** a new project is needed, 2. **When** the initialization script is run, 3. **Then** a standard folder structure (e.g., `src`, `docs`, `tests`) is created. 4. **And** a `package.json` (or equivalent) with core dependencies (e.g., a web framework, test runner) is created. 5. **And** a basic "Hello World" version of the app can be run locally. 6. **And** a CI/CD pipeline (e.g., GitHub Actions) is configured to automatically run linters and basic tests on every push.

artifact.title: Product Requirements Document
artifact.snippet: The Himolde Study Friend project aims to centralize course data, provide instant and accurate answers to student queries, and enhance the student experience. This initiative will save students time, reduce repetitive questions for staff, and lay the groundwork for future expansions.

artifact.title: Product Requirements Document
artifact.snippet: FR13: The user can interact with the chatbot through a web-based interface. FR14: The web interface shall be responsive and work on both desktop and mobile browsers.

artifact.title: Architecture
artifact.snippet: The Himolde Study Friend project aims to centralize course information through an AI-powered chatbot. The architecture will be kept simple with one backend service and a single knowledge base, supported by a manual or simple import pipeline. Streaming responses will be used to provide immediate user feedback.

artifact.title: Architecture
artifact.snippet: Project initialization will involve a sequence of commands to set up the Vite + React (TypeScript) frontend, integrated with Tailwind CSS and shadcn/ui. This includes npm create vite, cd, npm install, install Tailwind, initialize Tailwind, install @types/node, and initialize shadcn/ui.

artifact.title: Architecture
artifact.snippet: Frontend: Vite + React (TS), TypeScript, Tailwind CSS + shadcn/ui. Build Tooling: Vite/Rollup. Project Structure: Vite default. Quality: Vitest for frontend, ESLint + Prettier for frontend.

artifact.title: Architecture
artifact.snippet: Details the folder structure for frontend (Vite + React (TypeScript) SPA), backend (Python REST API), docs, and CI/CD (.github/workflows/). This story directly establishes these foundational directories.

artifact.title: Architecture
artifact.snippet: Story 1.1: Project Initialization & CI/CD Pipeline Setup maps to `frontend/`, `backend/`, `.github/workflows/`. This section outlines which parts of the architecture are touched by this specific story.

artifact.title: Architecture
artifact.snippet: Core Technologies: Frontend (Vite, React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui). Backend (Python, FastAPI, PostgreSQL, pgvector). AI (Gemini API).

artifact.title: Architecture
artifact.snippet: Naming Conventions: Frontend (PascalCase for Components, camelCase for Variables/Functions, Files match component name). Code Organization: Frontend (by feature for pages/major components, reusable UI in components/, utilities/API client in lib/, styles in styles/).

artifact.title: Architecture
artifact.snippet: Frontend (Vite React SPA) will be deployed on Vercel, and the backend service (Python REST API with PostgreSQL) will be deployed on Railway. This provides developer-friendly, managed hosting solutions.

artifact.title: Architecture
artifact.snippet: Prerequisites: Node.js, Python, Git, Docker (optional). Setup Commands: Frontend (`cd frontend`, `npm install`, `npm run dev`), Backend (`cd backend`, `python -m venv venv`, `pip install -r requirements.txt`, `uvicorn main:app --reload`).

artifact.title: UX Design Specification
artifact.snippet: shadcn/ui (v0.8.0) chosen for its strong alignment with the project's need for a minimal, highly customizable, accessible, and trustworthy chat interface. Integration with Tailwind CSS offers granular control over styling.

artifact.title: UX Design Specification
artifact.snippet: The application will provide a seamless and intuitive experience across various devices. WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliance is targeted, ensuring the application is inclusive and usable for all students.

artifact.title: Epic Breakdown
artifact.snippet: Goal: Establish the essential technical foundation, a structured knowledge base, and a working, responsive chat UI. This delivers the visible application and the backend structure needed for all future functionality.

artifact.title: Epic Breakdown
artifact.section: Story 1.1: Project Initialization & CI/CD Pipeline Setup (MVP)
artifact.snippet: As a Developer, I want a standardized project structure and an automated CI/CD pipeline, So that I can ensure consistent development practices and reliable deployments. This section also lists the Acceptance Criteria for Story 1.1.

constraints.constraint: Frontend Framework: Vite + React (TypeScript)
Styling: Tailwind CSS + shadcn/ui
Frontend Testing Framework: Vitest
Frontend Linting/Formatting: ESLint + Prettier
Build Tooling: Vite/Rollup
Project Structure: Vite default for frontend
CI/CD: GitHub Actions for automation (linters and basic tests)
Backend Testing Framework: Pytest
Backend Linting/Formatting: Black + Flake8
Frontend Deployment: Vercel
Backend Deployment: Railway
Frontend Naming Conventions: React Components: PascalCase, Variables/Functions: camelCase, Files match component name
Backend Naming Conventions: Variables/Functions: snake_case, Classes: PascalCase, Files/Modules: snake_case
Code Organization: Frontend by feature (pages/, components/, lib/, styles/), Backend by type/domain (api/, services/, models/, core/, db/, rag/)
Error Handling: Frontend Error Boundary, Backend consistent HTTP status codes and JSON error objects
Logging: Python's built-in logging module to console (DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR levels)
Data Architecture: PostgreSQL
API Contracts: REST, SSE/HTTP for chat streaming
Security: Dedicated DB user, HTTPS for all traffic, secure environment variables, AI safety
Performance: Vercel CDN, PostgreSQL indexing, streaming responses for perceived speed
Development Environment Prerequisites: Node.js, Python, Git

tests.standards: Frontend testing will utilize Vitest, following modern JavaScript/TypeScript testing practices. Initial setup will involve basic unit tests. Backend testing will use Pytest. CI/CD pipeline will automatically run linters and tests.
